column2: Job Description Summary The cyber security specialist works within a team of security specialists and analysts maintaining corporate wide information Security to ensure that information assets are adequately protected in relation to confidentiality, integrity and availability.  The role is accountable for the delivery of services in accordance with Service Level Agreements, business requirements and customer experience expectations and meeting required quality and compliance to standards.    Accelerate innovative science   Advancing high-potential late-stage pipeline projects, pursuing the next wave of disruptive biology and accelerating efforts in ML & AI, Data Science and Digital Technology  Deliver growth and therapy area leadership   Driving growth, impacting and improving the whole patient journey and collaborating with the funders of healthcare and third parties.  The focus on Digital, AI & ML, Data & Data Science along with joint ventures and collaboration with third parties are creating new opportunities within the IT security team. Cyber security will need to be the cornerstone of our IT strategy as we move towards our future objectives.?   Were looking for IT security professionals that can help us on the journey through this challenging and ever-changing technology landscape. Individuals who:?  Understand that security is a journey and not a destination. Cyber security is not something that can be fixed, and we instead need to focus on innovation to maintain sustainable risk position against the evolving threat landscape.  Understand that we cant just buy our way out of a cyber security problem. Technology may win the battle, but it won?? win the war.?  Understand that cyber security is not just dealing with over-enthusiastic teenagers. We are potentially working against state-sponsored attacks and multi-billion dollar organized crime syndicates.?  Understand attackers, their motivations and their ways of working to be able to get ahead and keep ahead of them.    The core accountabilities for the role include:?  Architect cyber security solutions for the organisation spanning Cloud, Hybrid and on-premise as well as third-party collaboration environments.?  Define principles, policies, standards and governance covering Cloud, DevOps, Corporate network connectivity, tooling, ways of working, application security standards, static and dynamic code review, penetration testing (both automated and manual / exploratory), monitoring (including Security Information and Event Management [SIEM]), mapping governance and compliance frameworks and controls to technical implementation, shifting hardening processes as far left as possible, network traffic inspection (including IDS / IPS)  Help define the future state of cyber security within the organisation, conduct review and gap analysis between current state and future state including existing measures and controls, and then work to uplift to align to the future state vision.?  Define security strategies, self-service standards and ways of working for users working across the cloud  Work with existing security teams to implement and enforce strategies and policies across the enterprise  Define and create a portfolio of secure design principles to support bespoke architectures that doesn?? fit existing patterns.  Collaborate with other architecture functions resulting in effective security. Supporting other functions towards a shared goal of delivering secure cloud solutions.  Ensure lastest trends and technology are considered as part of solutioning.? For example, consider the security implications of IoT being integrated into our existing landscape.  Define Cloud Security Architecture patterns and design principles?  Work with Solution Architects, Solution Engineering and Support functions to ensure that cloud solutions are secure and align with Security policies and guidelines.  You will also perform security reviews of cloud solutions, looking at compliance , but also how solutions can be improved for security in the way they are designed, used, built and maintained.  Advise technical leaders on cloud security when making strategic decisions  Designing or reviewing whether security controls for a computer system are suitable; this is based on an understanding of both use and context, and how the system will likely be attacked  Provide technical support and expertise to cloud users, and conduct architectural reviews throughout project and solutions design lifecycle. Education, Qualifications, and Experience   Essential   Must have an understanding of the Cyber Security Frameworks, methodologies, processes and artefacts.  Must have been a Solution Architect for at least 5 years covering solution, entererprise and consultancy activities.  Able to influence and position strategies at multiple levels to both IT and business functions  Have an excellent understanding and proven capability in Cloud, Hybrid and On-Premise architecture   Able to work across multiple teams spanning many geographic regions  Security, compliance and regulatory experience in a public cloud environment  Ability to carry out evaluations, gap analysis and vendor assessments for security technologies and applications  Excellent written and oral communication skills  Experience planning, researching and developing security policies, standards and procedures  Familiarity with common attack techniques and their remediation/defence including DoS, DDoS, Social engineering, Virus, Malware, Vulnerability exploitation, Phishing & Spear Phishing, Worms, Trojans, Rootkits, Ransomware, XSS, SQL Injection, Remote Command Execution, Session Hijacking, etc.?  Solid understanding of security protocols, cryptography, authentication, authorisation and network security implementations  Desirable   Experience designing secure networks, systems and application architectures  Knowledge of disaster recovery, computer forensic tools, technologies and methods  Knowledge of risk assessment tools, technologies and methods  Ability to conduct post mortem on security incidents and/or take post mortem data to drive uplift in policies, procedures, standards?  Experience in a system administration role supporting multiple platforms and applications  Security, Cloud and/or DevOps certifications  Experience working work closely with compliance and audit functions  Skills and Capabilities   Essential   Ability to design, build, test and implement cyber security solutions??  Ability to define principles, policies, standards and governance?  Ability to map governance and compliance frameworks and controls to technical implementation  Strong Cloud architecture and multiple domain experience  Familiarity working in and across large geo-disperesed teams   The ability to idetinfy and document security processes, techniques and governance into solutions  Ability to prioritise and validate the threats that really matter  Shifting security processes as far left as possible.? Build standards that are a part of the solution ??not an after thought.  Security roadmap and strategy development  Development of application security standards,?  Ability to implement and conduct static and dynamic code review process  Ability to implement and conduct penetration testing processes (both automated and manual / exploratory)  Security incident and event monitoring implementation (SIEM)  Understanding of authentication technologies and approaches.?  Desirable   Development of application security standards,?  Ability to implement and conduct static and dynamic code review process  Ability to implement and conduct penetration testing processes (both automated and manual / exploratory)  Security incident and event monitoring implementation (SIEM)  Understanding of authentication technologies and approaches.?
column11: Penetration Testing, Cloud, SIEM, Information Security, Devops

column2: Position Description  Sundyne is seeking an  IT Support Specialist Intermediate  to be the on-site IT Site Lead in our Pune, India office. Responsibilities will be to provide End User Support for Windows platform including but not limited to: Windows 10 OS, Microsoft Office application stack, Dell hardware, various peripherals, iPhones, iPads, Printers, Scanners, desk phones, Wifi dongles and other peripherals. Furthermore, the IT professional will provide support of Data Center systems working closely with remote Subject Matter Experts in server, storage, network technologies. Note this is a full-time and mandatory on-site role at our Pune, India facility with some travel to Mumbai or other Sundyne office in India.     Job Duties & Responsibilities  1. Desktop Suppor t a. Assist users in resolving issues with laptop, desktop hardware and peripherals (ex: desk phones, mobile phones, printers, keyboards, mouse, headsets, TVsetc.) b. Assist users in resolving issues with desktop Operating systems and applications (Microsoft Office, O365, Adobe, Edge, Chrome, add ins/plugins) c. Building and installing Desktop computing equipment using documented process and procedures d. Troubleshooting device for compliance to Sundyne standards e. Configuring and helping to maintain mobile phones and tablets f. Assisting in ongoing and ad hoc IT Inventory Audits g. Assisting in individual and multi-user PC and peripheral deployments, moves, and upgrades (i.e. PCs, Monitors, Docks, Multi-Function Printers, etc.) h. Maintain and Troubleshoot Meeting Room Technology (Projectors, Remotes, etc.) i. Assist in white-glove IT Support of Company Leadership j. Assist with IT needs on-site large meetings and conferences (I.e., Board Meetings, Forums, etc.) 2. Data Center Support a. Be the on-site hands and feet support for global IT team in resolving issues with servers, storage, network infrastructure requiring physical on site presence (Nutanix, Meraki Access Points, Meraki Switches and security appliances) b. Racking, stacking, and cabling data center equipment and applying base configuration to get device onto the network for remote team members to build/configure remaining components.  c. Assisting by maintaining Rack Elevation and switch port use documentation d. Perform daily/weekly checklist as assigned  3. Change/Problem/Incident Management a. Attend Weekly Change Management Meetings to provide input and feedback as it pertains to Arvada site IT Operations b. Attend Major Incident Response Bridge Calls to provide input and serve as Hands-Eyes for major incidents impacting the Arvada Site IT Operations c. Attend Problem Management Meetings to provide input and insight to remediation of IT Root-Cause Analysis of problems pertaining to Arvada IT Site Operations  4. Administrative/Other a. Managing, tracking and documenting local IT assets b. Administratively managing the procurement process for IT assets. This includes communicating with vendors, requesting Pos, processing invoices, validating IT product delivery against orders. c. Planning and assisting with new user onboarding or user offboarding d. Document Knowledgebase Articles and SOPs pertaining to overall IT Support Operations e. Partnering with Site Engineers and Operations Staff to support all business production systems and processes that interface with IT f. Other duties assigned by IT Leadership g. Assist IT Security in hands-eyes support of threat detection and remediation at a EUC and Data Center Layer 5. Project Management  a. Working knowledge of Project Management, including all phases within a project. b. Experience supporting manufacturing engineers c. Experience with engineering applications Skills & Abilities Some experience with MECM and SCCM in deploying Apps and Operating Systems Experience in Microsoft Office App Stack Experience in Microsoft 365 Experience in Windows 7 and 10 Operating Systems Experience in Engineering Apps (NX, Team Center, CAD) highly desirable, not required Experience in Security Apps (Qualys, Crowd strike, etc.) highly desirable, not required Experience in Network Communication (i.e. TCP/IP) highly desirable, not required Previous support and administration of network switches, routers, and firewalls (Cisco Preferred) highly desirable, not required Some knowledge/experience with Batch, Powershell, or other scripting languages. Experience communicating and supporting multiple audiences from Individual Contributors to C-Level Executives Written and oral communication skills  Ability to keep calm under pressure Planning and scheduling skills Customer Focused with a can-do attitude Ability to maintain multiple projects and initiatives at the same time Working knowledge of IT Security Fundamentals Additional Skill Sets A Plus Experience in industrial manufacturing environment supporting Engineers with any of the Following (TeamCenter, NX, Ansys, Engineering Base) Manufacturing ERP Systems (JDE, Syteline, Navision) Qualifications  A+ Certification, Network+, other certifications are a plus Completed Associates Degree and/or actively pursuing bachelors degree in IT-Related field 4+ years experience in a similar role

You will apply your technical skills to find the balance between enabling and securing the client's organization with the cognitive solutions that are making IBM the fastest growing enterprise security business in the world. E.g. include: Skills on Routers/Switches/ Load balancer. Typical examples of the other deliverables would be of deploying, managing and implementing networking solutions to address client business requirements. You will need to visit the domestic client's offices data centres on a daily basis or on an as-needed basis as part of this role. column2: Job Profile: DB Specialist (SSE/PSE)  SQL Server Experience: 5 -10 yrs  Job Responsibilities: Experience in implementing business logic using Triggers, Indexes, Views and Stored procedures. Understand Business Logic thoroughly and design, develop DB accordingly Should possess practical workings with large data sets and DB volumes. Should also be able to optimize database performance, ensure data security and access controls, and monitor database health. Development of high-quality database solutions & managing large scale database system is a plus. Extensive Knowledge of advance query concepts (e.g. group by, having clause, union so on). Strong experience in developing complex database code with T-SQL, SSRS and SQL Server following best practices to support UI, Middleware and Batch applications. Candidate should be strong in Transact-SQL i.e. writing Stored Procedures, UDF and Triggers. Proficient in Tuning T-SQL queries to improve the database performance and availability. Monitoring Server Performance using SQL Profiler, Index Tuning Wizard and Windows Performance Monitor. Experience in Creating and Updating Clustered and Non-Clustered Indexes to keep up the SQL Server Performance. Good knowledge in Normalizing and De-normalizing the tables and maintaining Referential Integrity by using Triggers and Primary/Foreign Keys. Providing production support of related systems and operations. Working knowledge of Power BI is a plus. Develop SSRS Reports and dashboards using Microsoft Reporting Services platform (SSRS), Microsoft SQL, MS Excel, pivot tables and other tools Analysis Services Cubes and relational databases Creating SSRS reports for different departments Ability to work in Agile development environment and work effectively in a fluid/changing environment. Adhere to project timelines and deliverable, effective communication of changes or disruptions to the schedule with a focus on expectation alignment Experience in architecture and design of high-Volume transaction processing database systems. Experience in Data Transformation Services like SSIS will be an added advantage. Provide regular and effective progress updates to and work closely with Development Project Managers to ensure the management of any delivery risks or issues. Responsible for managing technology in projects and providing technical guidance / solutions for work completion and able to lead and inspire their team, delegate tasks effectively, and provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers. Ensure process compliance in the assigned module and participate in technical discussions/review. Provide technical root cause analysis and mitigation plan Should be able to create technical documents and diagrams Skill Set: Strong communication and problem-solving skills. skills and team work Should have minimum 8+ years of experience in database development in a large enterprise environment. Proficient in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) Familiar and expert in Database Design, Development & Support of MS SQL Server 2008/2005/2000for Production/development. Expertise in Transact-SQL (DDL, DML, DCL) and in Design and Normalization of the database tables. Very good experience and understanding of database design/modeling, OLTP systems. Experience with either SQL 2005 or SQL 2008 R2 is a must. Working Knowledge on SQL 2012 is an added advantage. Performance tuning of database objects. Working knowledge in Database Administration & SQL Server Reporting. Ability to prioritize tasks effectively and reprioritize on short notice. Strong knowledge and understanding of RDBMS development techniques. Should be well versed with all phases of the SDLC. Software Development Process, Software Requirements, Software Architecture. Agile/Scrum project development. Strong problem-solving skills required. Have strong and confident communication skill set in customer support and presentation. Excellent Team Management skills should have experience in handing a team (5-9). Experience in communicating with engineering leadership to understand requirements describing software product features, technical designs, and product strategy.

column2: Job Title:  IoT Business Analyst (Manufacturing) Location:  Mundhwa, Pune Job Description: We are seeking a proactive and detail oriented IoT Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. As an IoT BA, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between our manufacturing processes and cutting-edge IoT technologies. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify, analyse, and implement IoT solutions that optimize our operations and enhance our products.   Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with stakeholders across manufacturing, engineering, and IT departments to gather business requirements for IoT initiatives. Conduct feasibility studies and impact assessments to evaluate the potential of IoT solutions in enhancing manufacturing processes and product innovation. Define and document business requirements, use cases, and functional specifications for IoT projects. Work closely with IoT developers and solution architects to translate business needs into technical specifications. Participate in IoT solution design and architecture discussions, ensuring alignment with business objectives and scalability. Conduct data analysis to derive insights from IoT sensor data and propose actionable recommendations to improve operational efficiency and product quality. Drive IoT project implementation by coordinating with project managers, vendors, and internal stakeholders to ensure successful deployment and adoption. Develop and maintain IoT performance metrics and KPIs to measure the impact of implemented solutions. Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies in IoT and recommend innovative solutions to drive continuous improvement.   Required Skills and Qualifications: Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field. Advanced degree preferred. 4-8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or similar role, with a focus on IoT projects within the manufacturing domain. Solid understanding of IoT technologies, protocols, and platforms. Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex business requirements into actionable technical specifications. Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities effectively. Project management experience is a plus.

column2: We have an excellent job opportunity for #TOPMNCClient for position of #SAP CPI Role for Bangalore / Chennai / Pune / Noida / Hyderabad location. Position Details: Profile: SAP CPI Role Location: Bangalore / Chennai / Pune / Noida / Hyderabad Exp: 3 to 9 Years Shift: UK Shift (2:00 PM to 11:00 PM) Notice Period- #Immediate to 60 Days(Serving Notice) Job Description:   We are seeking a highly skilled SAP CPI Integration Consultant with a strong background in Groovy and extensive experience in end-to-end implementations. The ideal candidate should possess exceptional problem-solving abilities, deep knowledge of SAP CPI, and a proactive approach to enhancing service quality and delivery.  As a SAP CPI Integration Consultant, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and supporting integration solutions, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring seamless connectivity between SAP systems and various third-party applications. Key Responsibilities: Lead and participate in end-to-end implementation projects, leveraging strong Groovy experience and technical expertise in SAP CPI. Understand and analyze business process flows, collaborating closely with functional consultants to gather requirements for interface development. Coordinate with third-party application owners for mapping, connectivity, and testing, ensuring smooth integration processes. Develop and Maintain APIs using API Management. Develop and maintain integration flows (iFlows) using SAP CPI Web UI, scripting languages like Groovy and Java, and API-based integration techniques. Troubleshoot and resolve connectivity issues, utilizing knowledge of adapters, mapping techniques, and message formats (XML, JSON, EDI, etc.). Configure and maintain standard adapters such as ODATA, IDOC, HTTP, SFTP, AS2, File, SOAP, RFC, RosettaNet, VAN etc., adhering to best development practices. Support operational activities including incident, request, change, and problem management aligned with ITIL standards. Provide technical insight and guidance to support other developers in integrating existing systems and following best development practices. Collaborate with clients to understand integration requirements, design interfaces, and support Go-live activities and post Go-live maintenance. Stay updated with emerging technologies, tools, and trends in SAP CPI and integration domain, continuously enhancing skills and knowledge. Experience working on BTP Platform. Requirements:  5 years of experience in middle ware application. Minimum 1 years of SAP Cloud integration experience Strong proficiency in Java, Groovy scripting, and scripting languages like JavaScript and XSLT mapping. Expertise in SAP CPI components such as IFlows, ICO, SLD, ESR, and ID objects, with knowledge of standard naming conventions and design guidelines. Design, deploy, debug, test and monitor iFlows in cloud integration.  Solid understanding of integration technologies and communization protocols such as AS2, HTTP/HTTPS, SFTP, RosettaNET, JMS, JDBC Strong Expertise with industry messaging standards such as IDOCs, XML, JSON, PIDX, WSDL, Delimiter and Fixed Length. Design, Test and Maintain Webservices using SOAP and REST Hands-on experience with technical adapters, B2B adapters, graphical mapping, UDF, and API management. Expertise in creating API Proxies and deployment. Strong proficiency in create, analyze and update MIGs and MAGs. Hands on experience with Open connector integrations. Hands on experience in Fixed and Value Mapping. Experience with Data sources Familiarity with SAP systems (S/4HANA, SAP ECC, SAP Concur etc.) and non-SAP systems integration. Experience with cloud-to-cloud and cloud-to-on-premise connectivity, cloud connectors, and API management. Analyze, Design and develop APIs using SAP API Management and SAP API Business Hub. Knowledge of CI/CD practices and tools (Azure DevOps, Git, Jenkins, etc.) and basic testing tools (SOAP UI, POSTMAN, etc.). Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Proven track record of delivering high-quality solutions, excellent problem-solving skills, and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Positive attitude and proactive nature to work with Cross-Teams. Working knowledge of agile and waterfall development methodologies. Self-motivated, strong interpersonal, Effective communication, and presentation skills. Preferred Qualifications: Certification in SAP CPI or related technologies. Experience with SAP BTP, SAP CPI-DS, CIG, and open connectors. Knowledge of SAP ALE/EDI/IDOCs, alert configuration, and transportation of design and configuration objects. Understanding of SAP PI/PO and SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).Familiarity with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices and tools   If anyone in your connection is interested for the position. Kindly connect on nadeem.shaikh@aloissolutions.com

Period report to be shared with stakeholders on progress and defaulters to seek support from Line managers and function leads for timely completion Assess current technology architecture for vulnerabilities, weaknesses and for possible upgrades or improvement Implement and oversee technological upgrades, improvements, and major changes to the information security environment Develop, implement, and monitor a strategic, comprehensive enterprise information security and IT risk management program to ensure that the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of information is owned, controlled or processed by the organization. Carry out yearly Information Security Risk Assessment for all required functions, quantity and monitor the risks till closure. Develop, maintain, and publish up-to-date information security policies, standards, and guidelines. Yearly refresh of ISMS policies as per latest Group Security guidelines, audit observations and local regulatory guidelines. Oversee the approval and dissemination of security policies and practices. Create, communicate, and implement a risk-based process for vendor risk management, including the assessment and treatment for risks that may result from partners, consultants, and other service providers. Carry out Vendor Due diligence as per the latest framework released by AXA Group Liaise with the enterprise architecture team to ensure alignment between the security and enterprise architectures, thus coordinating the strategic planning implicit in these architectures. Represent Security in Architecture Review Board and carry out Security Assessment for strategic projects and new products/solutions. Manage security incidents and events to protect corporate IT assets, including intellectual property, regulated data and the company's reputation. Work with various stakeholders to identify information asset owners to classify data and systems as part of a control framework Establishing security procedures, such as access control and employee security training programs Developing and enforcing rules regarding employee conduct while on the job Conducting security audits and periodic assessments of company facilities and systems to identify potential risks or weaknesses Coordinating with Group Physical Security team regarding potential threats to company security Conducting physical inspections of facilities to identify security risks and vulnerabilities Reviewing security procedures and making recommendations for improvement Conducting physical security assessments to identify potential risks based on location, structure, security measures, etc. Position Summary Information & Physical Security Manager is required to be hands-on with the implementation of best in class security framework in the organization in conjunction with local regulatory guidelines and group security standards & instructions. column2: Job Overview:    As a cybersecurity expert at Tata Communications, you will play a pivotal role in providing advanced cybersecurity consulting services to our clients across various industries. This position involves assessing security postures, identifying vulnerabilities, and designing and implementing security solutions to protect our clients digital assets.                   Responsibilities:                       Security Assessment and Analysis:                   Conduct comprehensive security assessments to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses in client environments.                 Analyse data to evaluate security risks and propose effective mitigation strategies.                   To determine the best method of protecting the network, data, software, and information systems from any potential attacks.                                 Security Solution Design and Implementation:                   Develop and customize security solutions tailored to the specific needs of our clients.                 Implement security controls, technologies, and policies to enhance client security postures.                       Incident Response and Threat Mitigation:                   Assist clients in managing and responding to security incidents and breaches.                 Collaborate with clients to mitigate threats and prevent future attacks.                       Security Policy and Compliance:                     Provide expertise in developing and updating security policies and procedures.                     Ensure clients compliance with relevant regulations and standards.                           Certifications Preferred:                               Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)                         Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)                     Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)                     Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)                     Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)                     Any vendor-specific certifications from leading cybersecurity solution providers                           Qualifications:                       Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field.                     5+ years of experience in cybersecurity consulting or related roles.                     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.                     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.                     Knowledge of industry-specific regulations and compliance requirements.                               Skill Area                     Skills Required                   Network Security                 network security protocols, firewalls, intrusion detection systems (IDS/IPS), and VPN technologies.                 Endpoint Security                 endpoint protection, including antivirus, anti-malware, and host-based intrusion detection systems.                 Security Architecture                 Understanding of security architecture principles and the ability to design secure network                 Vulnerability Assessment                 Capability to identify and assess vulnerabilities in network and software systems                 Penetration Testing                 Proficiency in ethical hacking and penetration testing                 Security Frameworks                 Knowledge of security frameworks and standards (e.g., NIST, ISO 27001, CIS).                       Certifications Preferred:                     Certification                     Relevance                   Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)                 Security and risk management, asset security, security architecture, and engineering                 Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)                 Management and governance aspects of information security                 Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)                 Penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and tools used by ethical hackers.                 Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)                 IT audit, risk management, and compliance.                 Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)                 securing cloud-based applications, infrastructure, and services.

column2: The Agile Security & Risk Management (ASRM) process has been established to perform risk assessments, ensuring security is considered as part of the design and throughout the project lifecycle. The ASRM process governs projects within the Planview time recording and management system. The role will be to augment the Information Security team to perform risk assessments of projects, provide guidance and acquire outcomes/decisions from the scrum master, enterprise architect, technical architect, solutions architect, data privacy officer, portfolio management office, strategic change development, IT Infrastructure and Operations and penetration testers.  The specialist will work under the responsibility of the Head of IS Services and Risk Management and will report to the Secure Project Lifecycle Team Lead.  DISCOVER your opportunity What will your  essential responsibilities include? Review submission of the IS Criticality Assessment (ISCA) questionnaire. Determine high-level security requirements and project criticality, based on standard project activities and data classification from DP pre-screening. Work with assigned architect to ensure security requirements are finalised in design (High-Level Design), review with Enterprise Architecture, Solutions Architecture, Cyber Security and Cyber Assurance. Review of all security requirements and evidence provided by the scrum master to support closure of each requirement. Review and feedback on the ISCA questionnaire. Review and feedback on High-Level Design (HLD). Present at ISCA Project Technical Review. Attend and obtain HLD sign-off at Technical Design Authority, Solutions Design Authority (SDA). Obtain Business Partner Risk Evaluation Platform (BPREP) scorecard for 3rd Party SaaS solutions from the Security Contracts team. Obtain Identity & Access Management (IAM) assessment signoff from the IAM Team. Obtain Minimum Technical Security Baseline compliance reporting from QualysGuard. Obtain a Cloud Permit from Enterprise Architecture. Obtain Code Review and Analysis in-house solutions only. Self-serve vulnerability assessment compliance report of assets in scope. Liaise with Cyber Assurance on penetration testing of solution and obtain sign-off. Obtain Digital Hub registration for external facing solutions from Cyber Assurance. Produce ASRM Security Assessment closure report. Perform a final review of all open security requirements and their status before any stage gate approval can be provided (effectively the Production Go/No-go decision). Ensure AXA XL ASRM processes are followed. Store all evidence in the IS project's shared area. Update the project register daily to ensure project status is maintained and update the ASRM Security Assessment template as a record of activity. Submit the ASRM form for sign-off to complete the risk assessment. Manage project RAG status ensuring activities trending amber and red are highlighted to management and the scrum master. Liaise with the scrum master to support the development of the risk acceptance (PM is responsible) where needed. Attend meetings with the scrum master, delivery squads, stakeholders, ISCA technical review, architectural design authorities and pen testing reviews. Challenge design decisions not compliant with security, escalate issues when they become known, and offer options to resolve them. All deliverables are subject to internal quality assurance and peer reviews will be conducted by the Information Security team.You will report to the Senior Program Manager, Information Security Services. Required Skills and Abilities: Bachelors degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field with relevant years of experience. Effective knowledge of working within an Agile Framework such as SAFe. Effective knowledge of performing project risk assessments. Experience in performing Information Security technical risk assessments. Proficient in information security risk and governance frameworks (ISO 27005, EBIOS). Expert analytical and reporting skills. Expert in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access). Ability to effectively communicate and positively influence diverse stakeholders and team members. Desired Skills and Abilities: Excellent attention to detail and the ability to create clear, concise, and engaging presentations. Fluent in English. Information Security and /or Information Technology industry certification (CISSP, CISM, CRISC, GIAC, CISSP or equivalent). Experience in articulating IS risks in business language and advising on the appropriate risk management action. Experience in information security management reporting and related methodologies. Experience in multinational companies.
column11: Agile Framework, crisc, enterprise architect, portfolio management, penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, security services, information security management, cism, it infrastructure operations, cissp

column1: Fiserv Hiring For Business Analyst at Pune
column2: Hope you are doing Well !! Fiserv Hiring for Business Analyst in Payment Clearing & Settlement with ACH, Fed Wire, Fed Now, SEPA knowledge, ISO 20022, SQL (advantage) at Pune Location. Please go through the below mentioned JD and share your CV at  ashok.biswas@fiserv.com ============================================================================ IF INTERESTED, PLEASE SEND YOUR RESUME ALONG WITH FOLLOWING DETAILS: ============================================================================ *Total Relevant experience (In Years): a) ACH b) Fed Wire / Fed Now c) ISO 20022 d) Payment Clearing & Settlement Domain Experience *Current CTC: *Expected CTC: *Notice period: *Reason of change from current employment: *Work From Office : 5days is fine with you ? Yes/No : * Shift timing is 11AM to 07PM Job Posting Title: Lead/ Advisor, Business Systems Analyst What does a great Business Analyst do? As Business Analyst , You will works as part of the delivery function within EPP, reporting into  one of the Managers within the Solution Functional Team. You will be responsible for analysing , documenting and proposing solutions for large and complex payment projects across a global client portfolio. The Senior Business Analyst will be hands-on in performing business level process analysis using the accepted tools and methodologies as well as preparing functional specifications. You will also work alongside the development teams to provide iterative analysis of the detailed specifications and to provide a link between the business and the development teams. The role is required to be performed from Fiserv India offices 5 days in Office. What you will do: ??Lead / Own the analysis phase of a project, typically with one or more BA?? aligned to support  its delivery ??Lead / Own and mentor a team of BA?? providing guidance, training and support on all aspects of the client project (not line management) ??Awareness of the overall project plan to then allocate and prioritise analysis work of other BA?? to ensure timelines are met ??Build and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders ??Collecting, understanding, and communicating the business requirements for the project, and translating these into functional specifications and detailed test analysis that can be utilized by the solution development teams ??Collaborate with technical and solution architects to define solutions ??Analyse and document business processes ??Document the results of business analysis and obtain sign-off from client on the specifications ??Provide the link between the client, development team and any third party regarding software functionality, throughout the development lifecycle ??Design, specify and execute test scenarios and test scripts ??Analysis, preparation and management of change requests in relation to the project plans to ensure agreed deadlines are met ??Communicate with the client?? subject matter experts and system users to identify business needs and opportunities ??Analyse and solve problems with integrated technology system software; determines and communicates need for technical analysis ??Develop and provide structured training classes for system users and ad hoc one on one training and user assistance as required ??Facilitate scoping and business priority-setting for client payments change initiatives of medium size and complexity ??Responsible for managing the overall requirements catalogue for a project ??Work with the Project Manager to allocate and prioritize analysis work to BA?? within project teams ??Support and develop BA?? working within your project team ??Performs other related duties as assigned or requested What you will need to have: ??Minimum of 5 years' experience in Product owner or Product Management in ACH Payments  domain ??Should have hands on Experience Payment Clearing & Settlement with ACH, Fed Wire / Fed Now, SEPA knowledge, ISO 20022, ??Knowledge in SQL is in added advantage ??Minimum of 5 years' experience managing the product lifecycle and launching products at various stages ??Minimum of 5 years' experience working with software engineers including designing user stories and persona mapping What would be great to have: Background in fintech or similar domains. Familiarity Payment and Settlement Domain.  Who We Are: We are Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, were involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv. We are a part of Fiserv Technology group. We deliver revenue generating and revenue protection projects for business units that provide best in class financial services products to banks, credit unions, and customers. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All the qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

column2: Role :  Data Security Engineer Work Location :  Marathalli, Bengaluru. Work mode :  Hybrid Qualifications and Experience B achelors Degree in information science or any relevant. 4 + Years of relevant professional experience in data security governance. Proficiency in managing Open Share folders in a Windows or Linux environment . Familiarity with access control mechanisms, file permissions, and security configurations. Strong understanding of data governance principles and regulatory compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA). Experience with monitoring tools and techniques for tracking folder usage and access. Ability to communicate effectively and collaborate with cross-functional teams. Knowledge of data security best practices and risk management. Job Purpose: The Data Security Engineer will be responsible for managing the governance validation of data sharing in Organization.  They will identify data sharing resources and validate its risk through collaborating with business units, following up with evidence, and properly documenting outcomes.  They will also collaborate with Data Event Incident Handlers on any data event that maybe be uncovered. They will also track and report on Data Sharing stats globally for executive reporting. The role will suit you if you are: Data Security:  Knowledge of different data security concepts; data loss, data duplication, data misclassification/mislabeling, data access, and data inaccuracies. Experience with data protection methods on various platforms and databases. Incident Handling:  Experience in critical trouble ticket management  or incident case management. Understanding how to analyze situations to determine the appropriate escalation path or closure path within compliance and governance guidelines. Monitoring and Reporting:  Experience in monitoring incident cases, generating reports, and identifying trends that can play into future  incident strategies. Compliance and Governance:  Understanding of data governance principles and experience in ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and organizational policies. Roles & responsibilities: Govern Open Share folders, ensuring proper access controls and security configurations. Monitor Open Share folder usage, storage capacity, and user activities to ensure compliance with data governance policies. Coordinate the setup, modification, and termination of Open Share folders based on business requirements and user access needs. Implement security best practices and protocols to safeguard sensitive data within Open Share folders. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand access requirements and ensure appropriate permissions are assigned. Conduct regular audits and assessments of Open Share folders to identify and address security vulnerabilities and access anomalies. Provide user support, training, and documentation related to Open  Share folder usage and best practices.

column2: We are seeking a dynamic and talented Technical Project Coordinator with a strong background in project management, technical background and proficiency in CRM tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, Zoho, etc. The ideal candidate should be adaptable, possess excellent communication skills, and demonstrate the ability to coordinate and manage projects efficiently. The Technical Project Manager will be responsible to be hands on and manage teams consisting of onsite and offshore blended resources in the development of multiple business driven solutions. The candidate should be a problem solver, have strong networking skills, and preferably hold certifications in project management. Roles and Responsibilities:   Project Management: Coordinate and manage projects from initiation to completion, ensuring timely delivery and meeting client expectations.   CRM Expertise: Proficient in using CRM platforms like Salesforce, HubSpot, Zoho, etc., to maintain client information, track project progress, and enhance customer relationships.   Business Strategist: Plan and Manage Projects aligning business goals with technology solutions to drive process improvements and competitive advantage. Understand business requirements and oversees the functional/business requirements of the client.   Continuous Learning: Display a proactive attitude towards learning and adapting to new tools, technologies, and industry trends.   Team Management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, providing leadership and support to achieve project milestones.  T ime Management: Efficiently manage project timelines, ensuring tasks are completed within specified deadlines.   Project Management Methodologies and Tools: Expert in PM Methodlogies like Agile, Scrum, Waterfall models. Should have good hands-on experience on PM tools like JIRA, Trello, Asana or any other PM tool.   Documentation: Maintain accurate and comprehensive project documentation, including Project plans, Project Schedules, Gantt charts, Status reports, and client communications in the form of MoM.   Flexible Working Shifts: Adapt to flexible working hours, including shifts, to accommodate project requirements and time zone differences for overseas clients.   Communication Skills: Possess excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal, ensuring clear and concise interactions with team members and clients.   Team Player and Problem Solver: Foster a collaborative and positive team environment, promoting effective communication and knowledge sharing. Identify and resolve project-related challenges promptly, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills.   Project Management Certification (Optional): Any certification in project management (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2, SAFe or any other relevant certification) is a plus. Qualifications:  Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Technology, Business, Project Management, or a related field.  Proven experience in project coordination or similar roles.  Familiarity with various CRM tools.  Strong interpersonal and leadership skills. If you meet the criteria outlined above and are excited about contributing to dynamic projects in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

column2: This Hiring is only for Immediate Joiners  NO NO Freshers and JNTU NO Others skill do not apply if you don't have knowledge.   Publicis Groupe presentation: Publicis Groupe is one of the worlds leading communications groups offering a full range of services and skills such as - digital: Digitas lbi, Razorfish, Vivaki, Rosetta,   - advertising: Leo Burnett, Publicis Worldwide, Saatchi & Saatchi, BBH,   - public affairs, corporate communications and events: Mslgroup,   - media strategy, planning and buying: Starcom Mediavest group, Zenithoptimedia,  - healthcare communications: Publicis Healthcare Communications group (PHCG) - brand asset production: Prodigious,  Founded in 1926 by Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, Publicis has grown from a small creative hot shop to the worlds third largest communications group with over 75,000 professionals throughout 108 countries around the world. Publicis Groupe is known as a pioneer in digital and interactive communications with of 50% of turnover in Digital markets in 2015.  Publicis is also a leader in fast growing markets. Altar presentation The deployment of an ERP aims to create consistent and efficient applications across our agencies on a global level, to facilitate real-time information sharing and analysis regardless of the size of the agency or its location.  This project, named Altar has been already deployed in Europe: France, UK, Belgium, Netherland, Germany, Switzerland, Austria, Spain and Portugal as well as a North America: US , Canada and  Costa Rica and also in Australia and India.   The Altar solution will provide a common process and application platform to all agencies and Shared Service Centres (SSC) for the following CORE processes : Client & Vendor set-up Manage projects Project Estimating Manage time & Expenses Purchasing & procurement Production billing Inter-company Finance ( Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, General Ledger, Fixed Assets..) Month end Closing All these CORE processes are supported by extensive reporting capabilities. The processes are run on SAP ECC6.0 (SD billing, MM purchasing, FI, CO, PS, AA) and SAP Netweaver (Portal, PI, BI). The following project tools are in use: Solution manager, Quality center, U-Perform, U-Learn, Loadrunner. The SAP platform will be fully integrated into the Publicis application landscape: HFM for corporate reporting, TMS for treasury management and dedicated applications for Media planning and buying Altair PI/PO CPI Expert Key requirements for this PI/PO - CPI position: - Good team player - Get it done attitude, able to deliver lessons learned from previous experiences and propose improvements / tools to increase overall services to our internal customers.  -  English is a must  in writing and speaking ,  any other language is a plus.  - Quality oriented, ability to deliver and communicate guidelines and reference documentation.  - Good communication skills with the different teams - Well organized and autonomous - Experience on implementation project, support activities, global SAP CPI project cycle.  - Good knowledge of PI/PO, PI mapping & Adapter Engine configuration: IDoc, RFC, File, Webservice - Should have strong knowledge of SWD, ID and ESR components, NWA, PI database operations, - Good knowledge of CPI: design, build, testing and troubleshoot integrations. - Within CPI, Expertise in handling integrations using ODATA, SFTP, IDOC, SOAP, HTTP, Process Direct, REST Adapters. -  4 - 8 years  of experience in implementation (development work in PO/PI and CPI) - Expertise in Transport methods - Should have experience in handling different data conversions like JSON to XML, CSV to XML, etc. - Should know about handling security artifacts, encryption, and decryption mechanisms. - Should be strong in defining custom Iflows , local & exception sub-process - Be aware of end-to-end process in integration domain - Be able to design and perform monitoring of interfaces  - Good functional knowledge of different SAP domains like SD, MM, FI is a plus Objectives:  As part of the team, ensure globally the good management of interfaces around Altair and participate to the development of some specifics:  Ensure production interface are up and running and properly monitored  Help on tests performed either by Core Team or power users  Implement new interfaces linked to deployment or the enhancement of the SAP solution ??Provide technical/development assistance to Core team ??Ensure that all interfaces??developments delivered will be reliable, maintainable, fit for purpose and will deliver good performances. Key Contacts : Altair Functional Core team  SAP Functional Experts Altair Roll Out Project team and management   Deployment team Altair Application Maintenance team   Support team Atair GDW team  Global Data WareHouse team Altair COE

column2: Position: SAP Technical Lead  Location: Bangalore Notice Period: 15 days to 30 days  Role & responsibilities   As a Center of Excellence (COE) architect accountable for all SAP technical areas focusing on design, coding, testing, quality assurance, RBA, Basis, security and supporting of complex SAP Application and Integration features  You will be responsible for driving and influencing technical design decisions for various SAP solutions across all modules of SAP S/4 HANA with a team of Subject Matter Experts, Architects, and Implementation partners.  Update and review global development standards, processes and strategies, and configuration standards and processes  Develop and manage process to optimize SAP Security (User Establishment, Authentication and Security Role Assignment)  Develop and manage our SAP Client Structure and Transport Path. Ensure identified Dev / Test / QA Clients are configured, deployed, and refreshed in line with development cycle  Develop and maintain appropriate documentation for system activities and ensure change control is followed as necessary  Work with internal IT teams and implementation partners in technical design, delivery, and deployment of solutions in ERP business transformation, upgrade and support projects  You should provide technical guidance, mentoring, and follow SAP best practices in the provision of SAP solutions and associated services to SMC2 business units  Understand existing business processes, business requirements and plan technology architecture and solutions in line with SAP best practices  You will also be providing support for and coordinate improvements and break / fix issues for the SAP applications with an emphasis on SD, MM, FI and other modules as needed.  Provide day to day system/process support to users in coordination with the corporate support team  Requirements:  A minimum of 8 years of progressive SAP Technical experience with at least 3 or more focused on SAP full life-cycle Implementations/SAP Transformation/SAP Integration.  Hands on experience in technical coding in SAP ECC or SAP S/4HANA (ABAP, UI5, etc.) for custom RICEFW developments  Working knowledge in ABAP enhancements, ABAP Proxies, RFC, IDocs, ALE configuration, Partner profiles, Ports, Enhancements, error processing, troubleshooting.  Experience in different integration techniques - e.g. File based, Web Services, SOAP and REST based API's, etc.

column2: Description - The BISAis responsible for supporting an IT wide information security management program along with Cybersecurity team, to ensure that information assets are adequately protected. This position is responsible for identifying, evaluating and reporting on information security risks in a manner that meets compliance and regulatory requirements, and aligns with and supports the risk posture of the enterprise. The position requires an expert with sound knowledge of information security technologiesand a working knowledge of business management. The BISAwill proactively work with IT towers/units to implement practices that meet defined policies and standards for information security. He or she will also oversee a variety of IT-related risk management activities. The BISEserves as the process owner of all assurance activities related to the availability, integrity and confidentiality of customer, business partner, employee and business information in compliance with the organization's information security policies. The BISAmust be highly knowledgeable about the business environment and ensure that information systems are maintained in a fully functional, secure mode. The BISA's role is to act as an interface between the Management's strategic and process-based activities and the work of the technology-focused analysts, engineers and administrators in the IT organization. The BISAmust be able to translate the IT-risk requirements and constraints of the business into technical control requirements and specifications, as well as report on ongoing performance. The BISAcoordinates the IT organization's technical activities to implement and manage security infrastructure, and to provide regular status and service-level reports to management. While the BISA is an expert of the security program, he or she must also be able to coordinate disparate drivers, constraints and personalities, while maintaining objectivity and a strong understanding that security is just one of the business's activities. Expertise in leading project teams and developing and managing projects is essential for success in this role. The BISAmust be able to prioritize work efforts balancing operational tasks with longer-term strategic security efforts. Other project management tasks will include resource balancing across multiple IT and security teams, task prioritizing and project reporting. Vendor relationship management ensuring that service levels and vendor obligations are met is also an important aspect of the position. Responsibilities Security liaison Architecture/engineeringcoordination Develop, implement and monitor a strategic, comprehensive enterprise information security and IT risk management program to ensure that the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information is owned, controlled or processed by the organization. Facilitate information security governance through the implementation of a hierarchical governance program, including the formation of an information security steering committee or advisory board. Be knowledgeableand keep updated and publish up-to-date information security policies, standards and guidelines. Oversee the approval, training, and dissemination of security policies and practices. Create, communicate and implement a risk-based process for vendor risk management, including the assessment and treatment for risks that may result from partners, consultants and other service providers. Create and manage information security and risk management awareness training programs for all employees, contractors and approved system users. Work directly with the IT units to facilitate IT risk assessment and risk management processes, and work with stakeholders throughout the enterprise on identifying acceptable levels of residual risk Provide regular reporting on the current status of the information security program to enterprise risk teams, senior business leaders and the board of directors as part of a strategic enterprise risk management program. Create a framework for roles and responsibilities with regard to information ownership, classification, accountability and protection. Provide strategic risk guidance for IT projects, including the evaluation and recommendation of technical controls. Create a framework for roles and responsibilities for main players Education & Experience Recommended Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. Typically has 4-7 years of work experience, preferably in IT projects, process improvement, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience. Shift - No shift premium (Mexico) Relocation - No
column11: Business Information Security, risk management, Vendor relationship management, information security, Business Information Security Analyst

column2: Title ATCI-LSS Job Description - Information Security Levels 10, 11, 12 & 13 Job Description Job Title:  Information Security Analyst Career Level:  Level 10, 11, 12 & 13 Required Relevant skill Experience: For CL 12 - 0 to 2 years For CL 11 - 2 to 4 years For CL 10 - 4 to 6 years Location: Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi\NCR, Hyderabad, Mumbai, Pune Entity: ATCI Local Security Support Skill Keywords: CISA, Security+, Risk Management, Cybersecurity, Governance Risks & Compliance, ISMS, SSAE18 SOC1& SOC2, ISO27001, Internal Audit, Information Security Audit Scope: Information security for the Advanced Technology Centers India (ATCi) Job Responsibilities: Project information security (IS) assessments are our bread and butter. As an IS professional, your first step into the big bad world of risk assessments will involve conducting IS assessments for projects across India centers. You will check if the project meets the Accenture standard and client's security requirements. The risks that you identify are super important to keep Accenture and our client's data safe, it will ensure that Accenture is compliant with what was agreed in the client contracts. We are super proud of the fact that Accenture is the biggest company of its size that is globally ISO27001 certified (the Academy awards equivalent for IS standards) and our team is responsible for maintaining this hallowed certificate. 3rd party auditors descend on us every year to make sure that we are still worthy of the certificate, so we've got to be on our toes always and keep everything shipshape. As part of this you will be carrying out a bunch of activities such as Making sure (via assessments) that the nice folks at support functions such as Workplace, HR, IT, Finance, Legal, Procurement etc. are compliant with ISO27001 security requirements. Risk assessments to report any risks that can mess up Accenture business goals and then monitoring these risks to make sure that they're fixed. Think out-of-the-box box and innovate to get all of our Accenture folk in India as IS literate as possible. In the past we've done super fun stuff such as plays, live sessions, infosec  gyan  during new joiner orientation sessions, etc the sky is the limit!  We also need to stay compliant to certain other regulatory requirements and those have their scheduled assessments and activities too. Remember point 1? where we spoke about checking if the project teams are doing the right stuff? Well, quite often our clients decide to pay a visit to audit if everything is in order here or decide if they want to give us more business. This is the high adrenalin stuff where our team represents Accenture information security and supports the project folks face the client auditors. Must Have Skills:Risk Management, Governance Risks & Compliance You need to have a genuine interest in the information security domain and have the spunk and drive to make a positive difference in the organization on ground. We work as a team and therefore you need to be collaborative well and a good team player. No room here for a lone wolf. Keep in mind that our role involves interfacing with multiple business stakeholders therefore you need to be able to speak to new people all the time. Goes without saying that good communication skills both written and spoken are quintessential for doing well at this job. Information security is one of the fastest changing domains, so you should have the ability to learn, adapt and evolve quickly to stay relevant in this field and the learning never really ends. We expect you to have at least a working hands-on knowledge of MS office suite tools like Word/Excel/Power-point rest of the tools you learn on-the-job. If you have a background in project management or technical IT skills such as networking, telecom, security tools etc. you will be at an advantage. Though currently we are working remotely, flexibility to travel both within your designated city as well as inter-city is important for you to be able to conduct assessments and other IS activities on ground. Last but not the least, a curious bent of mind and hunger / passion to learn is a great attribute we need from our IS soldiers. As they say, half knowledge is always dangerous, so we always welcome folks who don't stop learning. Ability to educate a non-technical audience about various security measures Attention to detail and time prioritization Good to Have Skills Professional information security certification/s ISO27001, Security+, CISA  etc. and knowledge of SSAE18 Experience in auditing  ISO27001  and the  SSAE18 SOC1& SOC2  controls Be up to date on the latest security trends Qualification Good to Have Skills Professional information security certification/s ISO27001, Security+, CISA  etc. and knowledge of SSAE18 Experience in auditing  ISO27001  and the  SSAE18 SOC1& SOC2  controls Be up to date on the latest security trends
column11: risk management, project management, cyber security, risk governance, cisa, it risk management, risk assessment, soc, information security, networking, auditing, siem, internal audit, it audit, operational risk management, splunk, data privacy, pci dss, sox

column2: We are on the lookout for a committed Information Security Analyst to become a part of our Security Operations Center (SOC) team         This role is pivotal in orchestrating the response to and mitigation of cyber incidents     The ideal candidate will excel in technical analysis, effective communication, and collaboration, ensuring the security and resilience of our information systems through comprehensive incident handling, root cause analysis, and the mentorship of junior analyst                       Responsibilities:           Adhere to defined workflows and processes for incident response and mitigation.         Gather and analyze artifacts pertinent to cyber incidents.         Conduct technical evaluations of impacted systems to assess impact, scope, and devise recovery strategies.         Manage cases effectively using a central case management system.         Mentor Junior Analysts by transferring knowledge and offering guidance.         Work collaboratively with team members, Information Security Engineering, and Subject Matter Experts to resolve security incidents.         Troubleshoot complex issues within existing security and privacy protocols.         Facilitate Incident Response activities, including evidence gathering, documentation, and comprehensive reporting.         Maintain thorough documentation of all activities and communications through ticketing systems, operational briefs, and status reports.           Educational Requirements:           Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent work experience.         Relevant certifications, such as Network+, Security+, GCIH, GCFA, etc., are preferred.           Experience Requirements:           A minimum of 2 years of recent operational security experience, ideally within a SOC.         Experience with dynamic and/or malware analysis.         Knowledge of Trellix Endpoint technology stack or similar technologies like IPS, EDR, and SIEM solutions.         Solid understanding of networking, system administration, and security architecture.         Proficient in executing incident handling procedures.           Required Skills:           Extensive knowledge of operating systems, including Windows, Unix/Linux, and OSX.         A clear understanding of cyber risks and the threat landscape related to cyber attackers.         Exceptional communication and presentation skills, coupled with the ability to work in a highly collaborative environment.         Demonstrated initiative, with a consistent follow-up on commitments.         Strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative work style.         Ability to manage multiple tasks in a high-pressure environment.         Demonstrated organizational and technical prowess.         Proficient in verbal and written communication.

As an Endpoint Engineer, you will play a crucial role in maintaining the stability, performance, and security of desktop systems. You will be responsible for the timely identification, testing, and deployment of patches and updates, minimizing vulnerabilities and ensuring the seamless operation of our clients' desktop infrastructure.  Preferred candidate profile   2-3 years of experience in an Endpoint Engineer role. Familiarity with Endpoint Protection platforms (ex. Sophos) Familiarity with Endpoint patching platforms (ex. ManageEngine Endpoint Central) Strong background in MAC OS and Windows Operating systems A+ and/or Security + Certifications preferred. Familiarity with ManageEngine Endpoint Central, Sophos, Addigy, and Intune is preferred. Be a positive team player and a self-starter who takes initiative. Role & responsibilities   Patching and Endpoint Protection Management : Plan, execute, and manage the patching process for desktop systems, including operating system updates, application patches, and security fixes. Patch Testing : Evaluate patches and updates in a controlled environment to ensure they do not disrupt desktop functionality or introduce conflicts with existing software. Vulnerability Assessment and Remediation:  Monitor security bulletins and vulnerability reports, staying informed about potential threats and their impact on desktop systems. Patch Deployment : Coordinate and execute the deployment of approved patches and updates to desktop systems, ensuring minimal disruption to end-users. Asset Management : Maintain client assets (add, remove, troubleshoot agent issues) within the endpoint management applications used by the EndOps team.  Documentation : Maintain detailed records of patching activities, including schedules, test results, and deployment logs. Compliance and Reporting : Ensure that desktop systems are compliant with security and regulatory standards and generate reports for management and compliance purposes. Develop and maintain automation scripts and tools for patch management to increase efficiency and reduce manual effort.  Work closely with the IT team, system administrators, and security professionals to coordinate patching activities and address security concerns.
column11: Sophos, Patching, Intune, MAC OS, Managed Engine, Addigy

column2: Job Title: SAP CO Consultant with Funds Management Expertise   Job Summary: We are seeking a proficient SAP CO Consultant with specialized expertise in Funds Management to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in implementing and configuring SAP CO module and Funds Management, along with a strong understanding of financial processes and budgetary control. As a key member of our SAP team, you will play a crucial role in delivering high-quality SAP solutions that align with business objectives and drive operational excellence.   Responsibilities: CO module Implementation: Design, configure, and implement SAP CO modules including Cost Center Accounting, Profit Center Accounting, Internal Orders, Product Costing, and Profitability Analysis. Funds Management Implementation: Lead the implementation and configuration of SAP CO module with a focus on Funds Management functionalities, including budget planning, availability control, and commitment management. Ensure alignment with organizational budgetary requirements and regulatory compliance. Business Process Analysis: Analyze existing CO processes and budgeting procedures to identify gaps and inefficiencies. Collaborate with stakeholders to define business requirements and design SAP CO and Funds management solutions that address key pain points and support strategic objectives. Customization and Configuration: Customize SAP CO, Funds Management functionalities to meet specific business needs. Configure fund types, commitment items, budget structures, and workflow processes. Develop and implement enhancements to optimize fund utilization and tracking. Integration and Interfacing: Collaborate with SAP FI (Financial Accounting) and other modules to ensure seamless integration with Funds Management. Configure interfaces and data flows between SAP modules and external systems. Perform testing and validation to ensure data accuracy and integrity. Training and Support: Provide end-user training and support for SAP CO & Funds Management module. Develop training materials, user documentation, and job aids to facilitate knowledge transfer and adoption of SAP CO functionalities. Address user inquiries and resolve technical issues in a timely manner. Lifecycle Management: Manage SAP CO and Funds Management system lifecycle activities, including system upgrades, patches, and enhancements. Conduct impact assessments and coordinate with stakeholders to minimize disruptions to business operations. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field. 5 years of domain experience in controlling or finance or accounting roles, with a focus on cost controlling, budgeting, funds management, or financial planning. In-depth knowledge of SAP CO functionalities including Cost Center Accounting, Profit Center Accounting, Internal Orders, Product Costing, and Profitability Analysis. Minimum of 2 to 3 full lifecycle implementations of SAP CO module, with specific expertise in Funds Management. Proficiency in SAP CO configuration, particularly in Funds Management functionalities such as budget planning, availability control, and commitment management. Knowledge of integration between SAP CO/FI/MM/SD modules is a plus. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. SAP CO certification and/or Funds Management specialization is a plus.
column11: SAP CO, Product Costing, Co Module, Funds Management, Profit Center Accounting, Cost Center Accounting

column2: Opening from GTS Job Title:  ServiceNow Engineer Location:  Chennai   Mode of Work:  Work from Office   Experience Required:   3 to 5 years Job Description: We are seeking a skilled ServiceNow Engineer with 3 to 5 years of experience to join our dynamic team in Chennai. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of the ServiceNow platform, with proven expertise in designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining ServiceNow solutions tailored to meet business needs. As a ServiceNow Engineer, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze requirements, design solutions, and deliver high-quality implementations. Responsibilities: Solution Design and Implementation: Design, develop, and implement ServiceNow solutions based on business requirements. Customize and configure ServiceNow applications, including Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management, Service Catalog, and Service Portal. Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze processes, and identify opportunities for automation and improvement. Development and Integration: Develop ServiceNow workflows, forms, scripts, and integrations using JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and ServiceNow APIs. Perform platform upgrades, patches, and enhancements in accordance with best practices and industry standards. Documentation and Support: Create technical documentation, including design specifications, installation instructions, and user guides. Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to end-users and resolve issues in a timely manner. Continuous Improvement and Learning: Stay current with ServiceNow releases, features, and best practices, and recommend opportunities for optimization and innovation. Participate in Agile development methodologies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives. Mentorship: Mentor junior team members and contribute to knowledge sharing initiatives within the organization.   Qualifications: Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Professional Experience: 3 to 5 years of experience working as a ServiceNow Developer or Engineer. Technical Proficiency : Strong proficiency in ServiceNow platform, including ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA) certification . Experience with ServiceNow ITSM modules, including Incident, Problem, Change, and Service Catalog. Proficiency in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and web services (SOAP, REST). Hands-on experience with ServiceNow Scripting (Business Rules, Client Scripts, UI Policies, etc.). Knowledge of ServiceNow integrations with third-party tools and systems. Soft Skills Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Certifications (Preferred) ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD) certification is a plus.
column11: ServiceNow engineer, servicenow developer, Certified System Administrator, Change Management, servicenow integration, ITSM, servicenow platform, Ui Policy, Business Rules, Problem Management, Incident Management, Service Catalog, Client Scripts
