Job Summary We are seeking a Senior Information Security Analyst with expertise in Network Security, Information Security (IS) compliance, control measures, IT infrastructure, and systems administration. Under the guidance of the IT Manager, the Senior IS Analyst will be part of the Joint IT Infrastructure team, collaborating closely with both local and global IT/IS teams on a wide range of IS/IT roles and responsibilities. Roles & Responsibilities: Security Monitoring and Incident Response: Continuously monitor network and IT systems for security incidents. Develop response plans to mitigate risks and minimize impact. Manage security tools and technologies such as endpoint protection, encryption solutions, and SIEM platforms to enhance Milliman Indias security posture. Work closely with cross-functional teams to update controls and document remediation patterns to maintain compliance with reliability, privacy, security, and regulatory standards. Produce regular reports, supporting continuous improvement of procedures and controls. Vulnerability Management: Identify, assess, and prioritize vulnerabilities in infrastructure, applications, and systems using tools like Qualys. Conduct vulnerability scans and penetration testing. Develop and implement plans to remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with Milliman policy. Security Policy and Compliance: Evaluate existing security controls and processes to identify gaps and weaknesses as per MISP. Design, implement, document, and test security solutions that align with industry best practices and our MISP. Develop, implement, and enforce security policies, standards, and procedures to ensure compliance with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001). Monitor and audit adherence to security policies and proactively address any non-compliance issues. Incident Response Planning and Management: Develop and maintain incident response plans. Implement responses to security incidents effectively in collaboration with GCS. Coordinate incident response activities across different teams and stakeholders to contain and mitigate security incidents efficiently. IT/IS Infrastructure Support: Collaborate with the IT Infra team to deploy and implement new technologies and solutions, providing troubleshooting support for IT/IS infrastructure-related issues to minimize downtime and disruption. Actively participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance IT infrastructure and IS services. Conduct Information Security (IS) surveys to assess and report on the security posture. Manage responses to Information Security Questionnaires from clients. Interact with multiple cross-functional teams to educate, train, and address questions related to processes, controls, and risk mitigation. Required Skills & Attributes: Knowledge of network security practices and anti-malware programs. Proficiency in security monitoring tools such as SIEM platforms. Experience with vulnerability scanning tools (e.g., Qualys, Nessus) and strong risk assessment and remediation planning skills. Hands-on experience with Windows environments and Microsoft systems administration, including installing, configuring, and troubleshooting Windows-based environments. Solid understanding of networking concepts (OSI network layers, TCP/IP). Ability to identify, communicate, and mitigate IT risk within technical solutions. To be successful in this role you will: Have a bachelor's degree in IT/CS or equivalent. Have 6-8 years in the IT industry with 2-3 years in Security operations and IT Security. Have knowledge of traditional Endpoint, Network, Perimeter, Endpoint Detection Response security product solutions, and Information security reviews. Have 2-3 years of hands-on experience with SIEM, EDR Tools, IDS/NDR, Email security, and exposure to Windows, Linux, and Open-Source Intelligence. Have a good understanding of ISO 27001/NIST frameworks. Have excellent verbal and written communication, interaction, and presentation skills. Good To Have Certifications: CEH, CISSP, CCNA, CCNP, or any certification in cyber security.
column11: SIEM, Security Operations, Edr, Endpoint, Ceh, Nessus, Endpoint Security, Qualys

column2: Are you a FRESH Engineering Graduate or Management Graduate with Engineering Degree, who graduated in 2023 or are graduating in 2024 and eager to launch your career in the dynamic world of technology?  *IGNITE: AgBe Fresher Hiring Drive for multiple roles in IT and Marketing* AgBe is excited to offer a range of opportunities across various streams including Software Development, Quality Assurance (QA), DevOps, Marketing, and Project Management. We are seeking passionate and talented freshers who are ready to take on new challenges, contribute innovative ideas, and grow with our cutting-edge tech firm. If you are driven, enthusiastic, and ready to be part of a forward-thinking team, we encourage you to apply for one of our many entry-level positions today! Location : Sector-66, Gurugram Work Mode : Hybrid No. of positions : 10 Minimum commitment : 12 months Compensation : Stipend of Rs 15,000 per month after 3 months of successful training and Rs 3.12L package after a successful one-year   Position: Software Developer Trainee Job Summary: We are seeking enthusiastic Software Developers trainees to join our team. As a developer trainee, you will be responsible for coding, testing, and deploying applications, and collaborating with senior developers on various projects. Key Responsibilities: - Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code - Participate in code reviews and contribute to the development of best practices. - Debug and resolve software defects. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. - Assist in the development and maintenance of software documentation. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. - Familiarity with programming languages such as Java, PHP, Python, C#, or JavaScript. - Basic understanding of software development principles and methodologies. - Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail. - Strong communication and teamwork abilities. --- Position: Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer Trainee Job Summary: We are looking for a meticulous QA Engineer Trainee to ensure the quality of our software products. You will be involved in the entire QA process, from developing test plans to executing test cases. Key Responsibilities: - Develop and execute test plans and test cases. - Identify, document, and track software defects. - Perform manual and automated testing. - Collaborate with developers to resolve issues. - Contribute to the continuous improvement of the QA process. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. - Basic knowledge of QA methodologies, tools, and processes. - Familiarity with automated testing tools is a plus. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. - Good written and verbal communication skills. --- Position: DevOps Engineer Trainee Job Summary: We are seeking a proactive DevOps Engineer Trainee to assist in managing our IT infrastructure and supporting software development processes. Key Responsibilities: - Assist in the implementation and management of CI/CD pipelines. - Monitor and maintain cloud infrastructure. - Collaborate with development teams to ensure smooth deployment of applications. - Perform system troubleshooting and problem resolution. - Maintain documentation for configuration and operational procedures. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. - Basic knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). - Familiarity with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI. - Understanding of scripting languages such as Bash, Python, or PowerShell. - Good organizational and multitasking skills. --- Position: Project Manager Trainee Job Summary: We are looking for an organized and motivated Project Manager Trainee to support our project management team in planning and executing projects. Key Responsibilities: - Assist in project planning, scheduling, and tracking. - Communicate project updates to stakeholders. - Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are met. - Prepare project documentation and reports. - Identify and mitigate project risks and issues. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field. - Basic understanding of project management principles and methodologies. - Strong organizational and time management skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Proficiency with project management tools like Microsoft Project or Trello. --- Position: Marketing Professional Trainee Job Summary: We are looking for a creative and driven marketing Professional Trainee to join our marketing team and assist in executing marketing campaigns and strategies. Key Responsibilities: - Assist in the creation and implementation of marketing campaigns. - Conduct market research and analyze trends. - Manage social media accounts and create content. - Collaborate with the design team to produce marketing materials. - Monitor and report on the effectiveness of marketing efforts. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field. - Basic knowledge of marketing principles and digital marketing tools. - Familiarity with social media platforms and content creation. - Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. - Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Be the on-site hands and feet support for global IT team in resolving issues with servers, storage, network infrastructure requiring physical on site presence (Nutanix, Meraki Access Points, Meraki Switches and security appliances) b. Racking, stacking, and cabling data center equipment and applying base configuration to get device onto the network for remote team members to build/configure remaining components.  c. Assisting by maintaining Rack Elevation and switch port use documentation d. Perform daily/weekly checklist as assigned  3. Change/Problem/Incident Management a. Attend Weekly Change Management Meetings to provide input and feedback as it pertains to Arvada site IT Operations b. Attend Major Incident Response Bridge Calls to provide input and serve as Hands-Eyes for major incidents impacting the Arvada Site IT Operations c. Attend Problem Management Meetings to provide input and insight to remediation of IT Root-Cause Analysis of problems pertaining to Arvada IT Site Operations  4. Administrative/Other a. Managing, tracking and documenting local IT assets b. Administratively managing the procurement process for IT assets. This includes communicating with vendors, requesting Pos, processing invoices, validating IT product delivery against orders. c. Planning and assisting with new user onboarding or user offboarding d. Document Knowledgebase Articles and SOPs pertaining to overall IT Support Operations e. Partnering with Site Engineers and Operations Staff to support all business production systems and processes that interface with IT f. Other duties assigned by IT Leadership g. Assist IT Security in hands-eyes support of threat detection and remediation at a EUC and Data Center Layer 5. Project Management  a. Working knowledge of Project Management, including all phases within a project. b. Experience supporting manufacturing engineers c. Experience with engineering applications Skills & Abilities JDE Experience is preferable. Some experience with MECM and SCCM in deploying Apps and Operating Systems Experience in Microsoft Office App Stack Experience in Microsoft 365 Experience in Windows 7 and 10 Operating Systems Experience in Engineering Apps (NX, Team Center, CAD) highly desirable, not required Experience in Security Apps (Qualys, Crowd strike, etc.) highly desirable, not required Experience in Network Communication (i.e. TCP/IP) highly desirable, not required Previous support and administration of network switches, routers, and firewalls (Cisco Preferred) highly desirable, not required Some knowledge/experience with Batch, Powershell, or other scripting languages. Experience communicating and supporting multiple audiences from Individual Contributors to C-Level Executives Written and oral communication skills  Ability to keep calm under pressure Planning and scheduling skills Customer Focused with a can-do attitude Ability to maintain multiple projects and initiatives at the same time Working knowledge of IT Security Fundamentals Additional Skill Sets A Plus Experience in industrial manufacturing environment supporting Engineers with any of the Following (TeamCenter, NX, Ansys, Engineering Base) Manufacturing ERP Systems (JDE, Syteline, Navision) Qualifications  A+ Certification, Network+, other certifications are a plus Completed Associates Degree and/or actively pursuing bachelors degree in IT-Related field 4+ years experience in a similar role

To be part of a global security operations center and be responsible for - proactively identify threats and vulnerabilities; implement industry best practices; participate in the review and resolution of opportunities from both internal and external IT security audits; provide recommendations to the overall IT security posture of the organization; and participate in the creation of IT security awareness communications to the organization that adhere to corporate safety and security regulations                       Responsibilities:                           Investigate and provide proper incident response to security alerts.                     Identify new security use cases and create required detection rules in the system.                     Work with the customer to gather requirements, propose use cases and build them in Splunk.                     Perform administration activities in Splunk including integration of log sources, creation of queries for security use cases, dashboards, troubleshoot issues.                     Assist and train team members on how to investigate and respond to various security threats.                     Manage and support wide range of security technologies including SIEM, EDR, Vulnerability Scanners, Identity and Access Management, Data Loss Prevention, and Cloud Security.                     Participate in security solution design and security consultation.                     Work with the customer point of contacts for any escalated incidents, security remediation.                     Create required dashboards and provide reports.                     Actively participate in customer meetings and give presentations.                       Job Requirements:                            Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or an equivalent degree.                             4+ years of working experience in Information Security.                             Vast experience in Splunk Enterprise and Enterprise Security.                             Have experience in integration of log sources, defining use cases, creation of new correlation rules, creation of dashboards, implementing best practices in Splunk environment.                             Good understanding of security threats and mitigation strategies.                             Have in-depth knowledge on how to investigate and respond to various security alerts, and can able to create incident response procedures for same.                             Certification in any of the following is a plus: Splunk Certified Admin/Architect, CEH.                             Demonstrated excellent response to critical incidents and security threats in the past.                             Excellent analytical, presentation, customer service and facilitation skills.                             Ready to work in 24x7 Security operations.

column2: Job Summary: The Palo Alto Architect is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the company's firewall and network security systems, primarily utilizing Palo Alto Networks technologies. This role involves collaborating with various departments to ensure the security of network infrastructures and to support the organizations overall cybersecurity strategy. Key Responsibilities: Network Security Design and Implementation: Design and implement network security solutions using Palo Alto Networks technologies, including firewalls, VPNs, and endpoint protection. Develop and maintain security architecture diagrams and documentation. Ensure the scalability, robustness, and reliability of security solutions. Firewall Management: Configure and manage Palo Alto firewalls, including policy creation, rule updates, and troubleshooting. Monitor firewall performance and security logs to identify and mitigate potential threats. Security Policy and Compliance: Develop and enforce network security policies and procedures in line with industry best practices and regulatory requirements. Conduct regular security assessments and audits to ensure compliance with internal and external standards. Incident Response and Troubleshooting: Respond to security incidents, conducting root cause analysis and implementing corrective measures. Provide expert troubleshooting support for network security issues. Collaboration and Training: Work closely with other IT teams to integrate security measures into all aspects of the network and systems. Provide training and guidance to IT staff and end-users on security best practices. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed records of security configurations, incidents, and changes. Prepare regular reports on the status of network security to senior management. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or a related field. Equivalent work experience may be considered. Experience: 5+ years of experience in network security, with a focus on firewall management. Proven experience with Palo Alto Networks technologies. Certifications: Palo Alto Networks Certified Network Security Engineer (PCNSE) or equivalent certification preferred. Other relevant certifications (CISSP, CISM, etc.) are a plus. Skills: In-depth knowledge of network security principles, protocols, and technologies. Proficiency in configuring and managing Palo Alto firewalls and security tools. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
column11: Palo Alto Networks, Palo Alto Firewall, Certified
